intro: Chloraea ulantha, commonly known as the mountain bluebell, is a striking flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped, sky-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine, silvery coating. Chloraea ulantha is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens that mimic its natural habitat.
